thread.title: Samsung Launches Galaxy Note 5, S6 Edge
thread.title_full: Samsung Launches Galaxy Note 5, S6 Edge

title: Samsung Launches Galaxy Note 5, S6 Edge
text:
17:12 CET Samsung Launches Galaxy Note 5, S6 Edge By Daily Guide 
Samsung Electronics West Africa (SEWA) has officially launched the Galaxy Note 5 and Galaxy S6 Edge + smartphones onto the Ghanaian market. 
According to Jaspreet Singh, Director of IT & Mobile at SEWA, the two premium devices deliver true value and usability to consumers. 
The launch, which took place at the Samsung Experience Shop, Stanbic Heights in Accra, was attended by technology addicts, businesspeople, journalists, among others. 
'At Samsung, we challenge ourselves everyday by anticipating the needs of our consumers and providing them with premium innovative devices that meet each need, guaranteeing them of the best smartphone experience they can ever think of,' he said. 
The Galaxy S6 Edge+ smartphone offers an exceptional multimedia experience with its 5.7 inch curved Quad HD Super AMOLED screen. 
With 4K (UHD) video filming and Live Broadcast, the Galaxy S6 edge+ users can instantly live stream full HD videos straight from the smartphone through YouTube Live. 
The newly-designed Galaxy Note5 provides an unmatched set of productivity tools such as SideSync along with a much refined 5th generation S Pen capabilities to better serve the major multitasker. 
Both devices feature Samsung's fast wired and wireless charging technology which is compatible with virtually any wireless pad available. 
With wired charging, both devices can be fully charged in approximately 90 minutes. 
They can be fully charged in approximately 120 minutes through Samsung's latest wireless charger. 
The Galaxy Note 5 and S6 Edge + are available in selected authorized Samsung dealer shops nationwide.
